author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: يا مَنْ بَلائُكَ دَوَآءُ صُدُورِ المُخْلِصِينَ وَذِكْرُكَ شِفاءُ أَفْئِدَةِ المُقَرَّبِينَ وَقُرْبُكَ حَيوةُ العاشِقِينَ وَوَصْلُكَ رَجَآءُ المُشْتاقِينَ وَهَجْرُكَ عَذابُ المُوَحِّدِيْنَ وَفِراقُكَ مَوْتُ العارِفِينَ، أَسْئَلُكَ بِضَجِيجِ الم
translation: O God! The trials Thou sendest are a salve to the sores of all them who are devoted to Thy will; the remembrance of Thee is a healing medicine to the hearts of such as have drawn nigh unto Thy court; nearness to Thee is the true life of them who are Thy lovers; Thy presence is the ardent desire of such as yearn to behold Thy face; remoteness from Thee is a torment to those that have acknowledged Thy oneness, and separation from Thee is death unto them that have recognized Thy truth!
